column4: [HELP]  Hi, I installed ubuntu with live cd and i had windows xp, i have done this so many times and it always worked, now problem is now i restarted and it doesnt show me windoes xp to boot ....so i am freaked out, i had this in past and i think i have to reinstall grub, but i forgot if thats what i have to do , please help me,  i know i have to put the cd in , run grub command but dunno what else then ., refresh my memory plz, i need to be able to run x
I meant into a terminal once you boot to ubuntu
this is the most obvious thing to do, first.
after sudo update-grub what should i do next?
in a moment, reboot. but while you're here, see if ''sudo fdisk -l'' shows your windows drive/partition.
it's -l as in the letter L, not 1.
sudo fdisk  says  /dev/sda1 Boot *  ID 7 System HPFS/NTFS  at then it lists the linux and the linux swap says Partition table entries are not inin disk order
ok, so your windows partition is there. see if it appears in the grub menu when you reboot.
I rebooted now but it still doesnt show me the xp in the grub,
ok. i don't know the solution. Re-ask the question, mentioning that you ran ''sudo update-grub'' and that ''sudo fdisk -l'' shows and NTFS partition.
ok thanks for ur help man, i will do the question again after trying a tuto i found in ubuntu forums , thanks for trying!
welcome. I doubt your data is lost.
hehe nah it isnt i had this problem in past plus i can see my windows files form ubuntu still so its there
